metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14864 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Ansible, versions 2.9.x before 2.9.1, 2.8.x before 2.8.7 and Ansible versions 2.7.x before 2.7.15, is not respecting the flag no_log set it to True when Sumologic and Splunk callback plugins are used send tasks results events to collectors. This would discloses and collects any sensitive data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.9.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.2+dfsg-1').
